channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MI

item.title: Report E-2025010012
item.description:
Report E-2025010012

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-19
  • City: ROMULUS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 20, 2024, at 1402 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner Transportation Services personnel in Romulus, MI regarding the release of Rectorseal SAM CL-3L Cleaner. The spill consisted of approximately 8 ounces of Rectorseal Sam CL-3L Cleaner (UN1993, 3, II), which spilled from 1-1 gallon metal can due to a loose lid during transit. The terminal stated there was no cleanup needed as whatever spilled had already dried up and evaporated upon discovery. Waste disposal is pending a response from the consignee as to whether they will accept the leaking containers or not.

item.title: Report E-2025010025
item.description:
Report E-2025010025

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-16
  • City: BYRON CENTER
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately five (5) gallons of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to improperly a forklift accident that resulted in the pail being punctured. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 10-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024120507
item.description:
Report E-2024120507

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T00:58:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-30
  • City: YPSILANTI
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 30, 2024, one (1) 50-gallon drum of UN1760 was damaged by a forklift and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the pallet and trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew containerized the damaged drum in one (1) 95-gallon overpack. FCE utilized granular absorbents and hand tools to remediate the surfaces and collected all waste in one (1) 55-gallon drum.
